data.title: Sam’s fandom and the birth of cinema | See these stories and more in Episode 7 of the ‘Olympic Zone’
data.meta_description: The stories behind the sports and the athletes are part of what makes the Olympics such a special competition around the world. The popular magazine show the “Olympic Zone” is a showcase of Olympics content that sets the stage for the most important action every night of the Games. Catch stories from the “Olympic Zone” on Click2Houston.com throughout the Games.
data.text:
The stories behind the sports and the athletes are part of what makes the Olympics such a special competition around the world. The popular magazine show the “Olympic Zone” is a showcase of Olympics content that sets the stage for the most important action every night of the Games.

Catch stories from the “Olympic Zone” on Click2Houston.com throughout the Games.

Relive the top moments (so far) of the Paris Olympics

Take a look at the top highlights from the first week of the Paris Olympics, from the swimming pool to the balance beam.

Montmartre: The Paris neighborhood that inspired Van Gogh

Long before Van Gogh and Picasso’s paintings hung in museums, the struggling artists painted in a whimsical neighborhood that overlooks Paris. Willie Geist heads up the hill and takes a tour of Montmartre.

Before Hollywood, France’s Lumiere brothers invented cinema

More than a hundred years ago, cinema as we know it was born when a pair of French brothers presented the very first film. Willie Geist has more on France’s contributions to film history.

Kiteboarding takes flight at the Paris Olympics

What do you get when you equip a surfboard with an airplane wing? Kiteboarding, a high-flying, unpredictable event that is making its Olympic debut in 2024. Naoko Funayama meets Daniela Moroz, a medal favorite.

Sam Watson wants to climb to new heights at Paris Olympics

Star sport climber Sam Watson tells Sam Brock about experiencing a new level of fandom, and how he’s preparing for the Paris Olympics.

How to make macarons the French way? Precision and practice

Many argue that no one can cook like the French, but that won’t stop us from trying! Savannah Sellers tries her hand at making macarons.
